translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Reverse Order of Dependent Origination

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.53. Upādānadukādi, Sanidassanattika🔽Noupādānaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  upādāna duka ādi sani dassana ttika  no upādānam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: The Numerical Order of the Dependent Origination, with the Three Characteristics🔽With clinging as condition, the three kinds of being ; with clinging as condition, birth; with birth as condition, ageing, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair come to be. So there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.🔽With ignorance as condition there are formations; with formations as condition, consciousness; with consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality; with mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base; with the sixfold base as condition, contact; with contact as condition, feeling; with feeling as condition, craving; with craving as condition, clinging; with clinging as condition, existence; with existence as condition, birth; with birth as condition, ageing, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair come to be. So there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.🔽With ignorance as condition there are formations; with formations as condition, consciousness; with consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality; with mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base; with the sixfold base as condition, contact; with contact as condition, feeling; with feeling as condition, craving; with craving as condition, clinging; with clinging as condition, existence; with existence as condition, birth; with birth as condition, ageing, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair come to be. So there is an origination of this whole mass of suffering.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With the arising of ignorance there is the arising of formations. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of formations. The cessation of formations is unconditioned.🔽With the arising of ignorance there is the arising of formations. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of formations. The cessation of formations is unconditioned.🔽With the arising of ignorance there is the arising of formations. With the cessation of ignorance there is the cessation of formations.
